info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 2:22PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN SAN MIGUEL...WEST CENTRAL QUAY AND NORTHEASTERN GUADALUPE COUNTIES THROUGH 245 PM MDT... At 221 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Conchas, or 21 miles west of Tucumcari, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Montoya. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 309 and 327. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 81 and 85. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.
